findings.title: Missing constructor leads to uninitialized owner
findings.explanation: The function 'missing' is intended to act as the constructor but is not named using the 'constructor' keyword or matching the contract name. As a result, owner remains uninitialized (zero address) until anyone calls 'missing', allowing an attacker to claim ownership at any time.
findings.fix_suggestion: Replace 'function missing() public { owner = msg.sender; }' with a proper constructor: 'constructor() public { owner = msg.sender; }' so that ownership is set only once at deployment.
